author: Reuters Editorial
title: Turkish parliament approves holding snap elections on June 24
text:
ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkeyâ€™s parliament approved on Friday a proposal to hold presidential and parliamentary elections on June 24, more than a year ahead of schedule, after President Tayyip Erdogan said they should be held early.
Parliamentarians from the opposition pro-Kurdish HDP party walked out of parliament in protest before the vote. The remaining deputies all supported the motion.
Reporting by Gulsen Solaker; Writing by Dominic Evans; Editing by Ali Kucukgocmen
